intro: Dichapetalum trichocephalum, commonly known as the hairy-headed dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, spherical flower heads that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
